content.webTitle: Travel news: How to surf 'n' turf

fields.headline: How to surf 'n' turf
fields.bodyText: Just put your foot down. One of the world's greatest driving routes has now become one of the world's greatest walking routes. Stage one of Australia's Great Ocean Walk has opened in the state of Victoria and is set to become a classic experience for hikers. The route follows that of the Great Ocean Road from Apollo Bay to Cape Otway, taking in the thundering Otway Range mountains, dense forests and secluded beaches. Just 32km of the 91km route have opened so far, and there are many small sections that can be walked in one or two days, with campsites dotted along the route. Details at parkweb.vic.gov.au.
